1.title: We're Back
1.plot: We meet the new member of The Creeping Bent Orchestra - FRANK VOMIT, Ms. Chaos Divine dances in front of Hamiltons waterfalls and we take a trip to the C.B.S Safari Expedition in Killman Zoo.

3.title: Love Thy Neighbor or Punch His Lights Out
3.plot: Talk about "Demodex Folliculorums". ALLAN (the alien) in his U.F.O., introduces "Hamilton From Above" - aerial footage of Hamilton's steel factory and the local Hamilton jail.

4.title: TG and the Swampbusters
4.plot: On the set with Cadillac Bill and The Creeping Bent Orchestra, talking about aliens. We then see a video made by Bill of TG and The Swampbusters called "Bayou Preacher".

5.title: Deer and Reptile Show
5.plot: he show starts off with Bill and The Bent being represented by finger puppets. Segment reporter, Jodi takes us on a nature tour of Hamilton to see some deer and demonstrates her skills at doing animal sounds.

6.title: Ginger St. James
6.plot: In depth talk with Allan, followed by "Hamilton From Above" (from the C.B.S. drone, filming areal footage of Hamilton Mountain). Then reporter Bill takes us to see Ginger St. James' CD release and a report on the new washrooms.

7.title: CBS International
7.plot: In this "international" show, the guest is Damien Reilly from Australia. Talk includes: the show being distributed internationally by Planet Blue Pictures, also a discussions about plans to build the Australian canal.

8.title: Ronnie Hawkins and the Super Full Moon
8.plot: Bill talks Rock a Billy legend Ronnie Hawkins along with interviewing Finger Eleven's Rick Jackett and Ronnie Hawkins manager Ronnie Hawkins.

9.title: Hamilton's Fashion Couture
9.plot: Bill talks about Facebooks's "Ice-bucket Challenge" and then gets ice water dumped on him. Various interviews with some of Hamilton's unusual eccentrics, ending with an in depth report on Hamilton's fashion show.

10.title: Psychic Hamilton & the CBS Blimp
10.plot: Chaos interviews the owner of an occult store called "Ways of Wisdom" about exorcisms and mental illnesses. Then she meets with another psychic and more discussions about exorcisms and animal reiki.

11.title: Halloween & the Masonic Temple
11.plot: CHERYL TYCE contacts Hamilton spirits at "Hamilton's Scottish Rite, Masonic Temple". Also STEPHANIE LECHNIAK from "Haunted Hamilton" gives us a guided tour of the temple, including some secret areas and the history of the building.

12.title: My #1 Ride & Psychic Hamilton
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: Dundurn Castle and More Ginger
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: The Beginning
1.plot: Shane Shaft introduces this episode, followed by the intro theme to footage of King St. In this first episode of THE CADILLAC BILL SHOW we meet the members of The Creeping Bent Orchestra. 12 year old Kyra is debuted with her original song "Stand Strong" in a video by (Caillac) Bill Boyd-Wilson. We then visit a classic car show where Bill interviews the owners of various Cadillacs. The musical guest at the car show is Ginger St. James, a Hamilton rock 'a' Billy singer. After hearing some of her music, Bill interviews Ginger. Back to the studio with more outrageous ...

2.title: Ghost Talk and Dave Collier
2.plot: After some studio banter about Dan's hat we meet Sophie (the Dachshund) that wears clothes. Then followed by a paranormal investigation of Hamilton spirits in "Ghost Talk" with Cheryl Tyce. Hear actual audio of ghosts responding to Cheryl's questions at Dundurn Cemetery. This is not fake; very much real! Next is an interview (on the Hamilton Library's "Bookmobile") with a local eccentric, Hamilton graphic artist called David Collier who talks mostly about the importance of vitamin E and reading outdoors in the nude. The Creeping Bent Orchestra plays "Funky Cold Medina...

3.title: British Car Show
3.plot: Cadillac Bill takes to the streets reporting at a classic British car show in Oakville while a WW1 air show occurs overhead.

4.title: Hammercity Roller Girls and Tom Wilson
4.plot: Bill talks to Mike Holler about his "Marlin", fish shirt. Then reporter, Cadillac Bill, visits a roller derby event and talks with the Hammercity Roller Girls.

5.title: Robert Gordon
5.plot: This "GHOST TALK" segment is at Century Manor, an old turn of the century mental institution. Plenty of good stuff here from Hamilton spirits. Back to the studio as Bill and the Creeping Bent Orchestra discusses creepy insane asylums.

6.title: Anvil
6.plot: . Bill introduces the new addition to the set - a stuffed Canada goose. Bill then reports from "The Baycity Music Hall" where the legendary heavy metal band is performing. Interviews with Lips and Robb Reiner from Anvil.

7.title: Doctor Scott
7.plot: Bill and Shane visit Gage Park. With Bill in his Justin Bieber wig, they play in the park to the music "Eating Out".Back to the studio for a discussion about Mike winning a "Zapruda" award for video excellence.

8.title: Trick or Treating (With the Bent)
8.plot: Halloween special including live performances from the Creeping Bent Orchestra also Bill heads off to trick or treat.

9.title: The Royal Canadian Sea Cadets
9.plot: Bill and The Bent talk about Mike's porcelain swan. We then head off to visit the Royal Canadian Sea Cadets - (young boys and girls in training to be naval cadets).

10.title: U.F.O and Dragon Special
10.plot: In depth talk about the possible existence of dragons with the Creeping Bent Orchestra serving as the "esteemed panel of experts". Bill scientifically, almost proves that dragons actually existed.

11.title: Bomber Bill and the Bookmobile
11.plot: An animated film of Wing Commander Bill as he goes on a bombing mission in a Lancaster over Germany. Lots of fun, until he crashes into the Dover Cliffs while returning to Biggin Hill Air Base.

12.title: James Street: Part 1
12.plot: Reporter Bill takes us to James Street where we see the James Street Bookseller (a vintage book store, owned by Monique Doepel). Here, Bill plays a 1959 '78rpm record of his mother singing "It Had To Be You".

13.title: James Street: Part 2
13.plot: Bill takes us back to James Street where we see Lynne Jury at "Let Them Eat Cakes". Bill gets some cupcakes here and takes them to The Dungeon Divas (a store for BDSM and other sexual and erotic devices).

14.title: Bill's Parents
14.plot: Bill talks about The Garden Club of Hamilton, an organization that his mother is a member of. Discussions include "refuse containers" and "the adopt a bulb program".

15.title: Finale Award Show
15.plot: Season finale one hour award show. Bill announces that this is the final show and proceeds to hand out awards to all the principle contributors for the previous episodes of season 1.

imdb.plot outline: This is a Hamilton based variety show that is entertaining, unusual and informative. It covers many types of topics but usually off-beat subject matter in a unique style. The show is about all aspects of Hamilton life: from music to paranormal investigations, from car shows to U.F.O.s, Hammercity Roller Girls to Dungeon Divas. THE CADILLAC BILL SHOW delves deep into the odd and sublime underbelly of Hamilton. It's not really a comedy, but it is funny. Musical guests have included Ginger St. James, Tom Wilson, Robert Gordon, Jack Pedler and Anvil.
